intro: Mairia coriacea, commonly known as the rough mairia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are usually rough to the touch, giving it its common name, and it produces small, fragrant blossoms. Mairia coriacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
